meanings.definition: Cowages (noun): the seeds of a tropical leguminous plant, used as a source of oil and for medicinal purposes.
meanings.sent1: The cowages were ground into powder for their healing properties.
meanings.sent2: Farmers collect cowages to extract oil for cooking.
meanings.sent3: The cowages danced in the wind, spreading their magic healing dust.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like cowages, bringing comfort and healing to all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The cowages shimmered in the sunlight, promising health and wellness.

meanings.definition: Cowages (verb): to gather or harvest cowages seeds.
meanings.sent1: She cowages the seeds carefully to ensure a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent2: Every year, they cowages the plant to collect the valuable seeds.
meanings.sent3: He cowages with such enthusiasm that even the plants seem to smile.
meanings.sent4: The farmers cowages the seeds with precision, knowing their value.
meanings.sent5: As she cowages, the field comes alive with the promise of abundance.
